intro: Capraria dissecta, commonly known as the dissected capraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, finely dissected leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
